text:
All RLimit directives are working and override the global setting in httpd.conf 
where are placed in .htaccess file and AllowOverride is not set to None. In the 
apache docs the context of these directives is "Context: server config, virtual 
host". I still can`t find a way to disable this directives in .htaccess without 
set AllowOverride to None.
creator: bugtraq@hosting333.com
nd@perlig.de
text:
That's a documentation bug. The directives are actually AllowOverride All.
(already fixed in 2.0 docs).

You can override (not only) any RlimitFoo from .htaccess using Location containers.

creator: bugtraq@hosting333.com
text:
Thank you for the reply. Is there any other option except the AllowOverride 
None, that can prevent the overriding of the RLimit* directives in 
the .htaccess files ?

As said, you can use Location containers to override nearly all stuff from
.htaccess files.
creator: nd@perlig.de

text:
Yes this is true, but it will be much better to have an option in AllowOverride 
directive that can disable RLimit* in .httaccess files. Beacause when you 
enforce the RLimit* for all with:

<Location "/">
RLimitNPROC 30 30 
</Location> 

It is hard to increase the limit for a specific virtual host because 
<VirtualHost> section is proceeded before <Location> section.
creator: bugtraq@hosting333.com

text:
<VirtualHost foo>
  <Location />
    RlimitMEM x y
  </Location>
</VirtualHost>

Please read the documentation about how sections are merged.
creator: nd@perlig.de

text: Thank you for the reply and for the patience. This will do the work.
